intro: Hornungia angustilimbata, commonly known as the narrow-limbed hornungia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and slender, upright flowering stems. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Hornungia angustilimbata is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
